page.title: Timeline of the 2011 Egyptian revolution under Hosni Mubarak's rule

rev.comment: /* 8 February â Day of Egypt's Love */
rev.diff:
Line 290: Line 290:
In a statement on Egyptian state television, Suleiman announced the formation of two independent committees for political and constitutional reforms, both starting work immediately. One committee would carry out constitutional and legislative amendments to enable a shift of power. The other would monitor the implementation of all proposed reforms. Suleiman also stressed that demonstrators would not be prosecuted and that a separate independent fact-finding committee would be established to probe the violence of 2 February.<ref name="aljazeera4">{{cite web |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/02/201128123235508653.html |title=Protests swell at Tahrir Square
In a statement on Egyptian state television, Suleiman announced the formation of two independent committees for political and constitutional reforms, both starting work immediately. One committee would carry out constitutional and legislative amendments to enable a shift of power. The other would monitor the implementation of all proposed reforms. Suleiman also stressed that demonstrators would not be prosecuted and that a separate independent fact-finding committee would be established to probe the violence of 2 February.<ref name="aljazeera4">{{cite web |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/02/201128123235508653.html |title=Protests swell at Tahrir Square
â
|publisher=[[Al-Jazeera English]] |date= 8 February 2011 |accessdate= 8 February 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pbs.org/newshour/rundown/2011/02/massive-demonstrations-in-cairo-draw-thousands.html|title=Egypt's Military Leaders Dissolve Parliament, Suspend Constitution, New Strikes Begin |publisher=PBS |date=|accessdate=2011-03-05}}</ref> He said that wider press freedoms were under consideration and that he would produce a list of what was needed to hold free elections.<ref>{{cite web|last=Namatalla |first=Ahmed A |url=http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-02-08/suleiman-to-meet-media-chiefs-in-bid-to-show-egypt-moving-on-press-freedom.html |title=Egyptians Rally in Cairo as Suleiman Pledges Change |publisher=Bloomberg |date= |accessdate=2011-02-08}}</ref> He also said that plans were underway to organise a peaceful transfer of power.<ref name="aljazbloglive8feb" /> Suleiman reiterated his view that Egypt was not ready for democracy, while warning of a possible [[coup d'Ã©tat]] unless demonstrators agreed to enter negotiations.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://apnews.myway.com//article/20110209/D9L9A7UO0.html |title=Egypt protesters defy VP warnings they must stop |publisher=Apnews.myway.com |date= |accessdate=2011-02-09}}</ref>
+
|publisher=[[Al-Jazeera English]] |date= 8 February 2011 |accessdate= 8 February 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pbs.org/newshour/rundown/2011/02/massive-demonstrations-in-cairo-draw-thousands.html|title=Egypt's Military Leaders Dissolve Parliament, Suspend Constitution, New Strikes Begin |publisher=PBS |date=|accessdate=2011-03-05}}</ref> He said that wider press freedoms were under consideration and that he would produce a list of what was needed to hold free elections.<ref>{{cite web|last=Namatalla |first=Ahmed A |url=http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-02-08/suleiman-to-meet-media-chiefs-in-bid-to-show-egypt-moving-on-press-freedom.html |title=Egyptians Rally in Cairo as Suleiman Pledges Change |publisher=Bloomberg |date= |accessdate=2011-02-08}}</ref> He also said that plans were underway to organize a peaceful transfer of power.<ref name="aljazbloglive8feb" /> Suleiman reiterated his view that Egypt was not ready for democracy, while warning of a possible [[coup d'Ã©tat]] unless demonstrators agreed to enter negotiations.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://apnews.myway.com//article/20110209/D9L9A7UO0.html |title=Egypt protesters defy VP warnings they must stop |publisher=Apnews.myway.com |date= |accessdate=2011-02-09}}</ref>
Ibrahim Yosri, a lawyer and former deputy foreign minister, drafted a petition, along with 20 other lawyers, asking the Prosecutor General Abdel Meguid Mahmoud to try Mubarak and his family for stealing state wealth.<ref name="aljazeera4" />
Ibrahim Yosri, a lawyer and former deputy foreign minister, drafted a petition, along with 20 other lawyers, asking the Prosecutor General Abdel Meguid Mahmoud to try Mubarak and his family for stealing state wealth.<ref name="aljazeera4" />
